title: Freerice.com
content:
For a spread I’m working on I’m interested in matching the logo font and the font used in the graphic. WhatTheFont wasn’t able to help, so I hope the experts here will be able to.

Thanks!

 [‹ TAYLOR TAYLOR LONDON ( wide sans caps )](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314123441/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39673 "Go to previous forum topic") [deco train station font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314123441/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39641 "Go to next forum topic")
author: medgno

comments.content: Then please post a graphic image here — most of us don’t have time to go browsing!

[http://freerice.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314123441/http:/freerice.com/ "http://freerice.com/")

And once you get there, you may not be back for a while. :-)

(No idea about the font.)

**Linda:** Terribly sorry about that. I’m new here and it slipped my mind. Please excuse the faux pas. Image should be attached.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314123441im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/screenie_6196.png)
Wow, how did I miss that searching? I’m sorry for wasting space on this forum.
A related question: if it’s exclusively licensed to France Telecom, how did it show up on the free rice site?
